author: Natasha Korecki
description: First, Texas House Democrats refused to meet in their legislative chamber in an act of resistance.
title: Texas Democratic legislator to stay in state capitol after refusing law enforcement escort to leave

author: Jonathan Allen
description: President Donald Trump said Monday that he will "lead a movement" to end mail-in balloting in elections.
title: Trump reignites his push to ban mail-in voting after meeting with Putin

author: Angela Yang
description: Controversial influencers Andrew and Tristan Tate are suing Meta and TikTok for banning their social media accounts in 2022
title: Andrew Tate sues Meta and TikTok for ‘deplatforming’ him in 2022

author: Rob Wile
description: A ticket-reselling operation used a network of fake accounts to bypass Ticketmaster’s security protocols to grab hundreds of thousands of tickets to hugely popular tours for artists like Taylor Swift and Bruce Springsteen and then re-sold them for millions, federal regulators said Monday
title: Group accused of using fake accounts to buy 321,000 tickets to Taylor Swift and Springsteen shows

author: Sam Brock
description: The drug Elamipretide from Stealth BioTherapeutics treats an ultrarare, fatal disease called Barth syndrome. Small studies say it's safe and effective. But the FDA denied approval, leaving children with few options.
title: Time is running out for kids with a rare disease, parents say, unless the FDA acts

author: Jo Yurcaba
description: Yosemite National Park fired a park ranger last week for hanging a transgender pride flag on the park’s iconic El Capitan rock formation in May.
title: Park ranger fired after helping drape a transgender pride flag on Yosemite's El Capitan

author: The Politics Desk
description: In today’s edition, we have the latest on President Donald Trump’s meeting with Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Republicans’ redistricting plans in Texas now that a group of Democratic lawmakers have returned home.
title: Trump meets Zelenskyy, take two: From the Politics Desk

author: NBC Bay Area staff
description: As San Jose crews began clearing a homeless encampment Monday morning at Columbus Park, they found a man’s body inside an RV, police confirmed
title: Man's body found in RV as crews clear San Jose encampment

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: A woman has sued a Florida dairy farm linked by state officials to an outbreak of infections from consuming raw milk, claiming she lost her unborn child while caring for her toddler who got sick from the milk.
title: Woman says raw milk sickened her toddler and led to loss of unborn baby, sues Florida dairy farm

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: Keegan Bradley, 39, will be the youngest captain of a Ryder Cup squad since Arnold Palmer in 1963.
title: A Ryder Cup putt changed his life. Now he's the captain of the United States team.

author: Tim Stelloh
description: A California woman known as the “Ketamine Queen” has agreed to plead guilty to federal drug charges in connection with Matthew Perry’s fatal overdose two years ago
title: 'Ketamine Queen' to plead guilty in Matthew Perry's death, officials say

author: Doha Madani
description: The government is urging people to be wary of fake Labubu dolls known as "Lafufus" as the knock-off versions "pose a serious risk of choking and death to young children."
title: Fake Labubu dolls known as 'Lafufus' are choking hazards that could kill kids, government warns

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Authorities searching for a 7-month-old boy who was reportedly kidnapped outside a California store said his mother has provided inconsistent statements, and foul play cannot be ruled out
title: Police find 'inconsistencies' after mom says 7-month-old boy was kidnapped outside California store

author: Denise Chow
description: Hurricane Erin strengthened back into a Category 4 behemoth over the weekend, the latest shift in what has been a remarkably fast-changing storm
title: Climate change is increasing the risk of rapidly intensifying storms. Hurricane Erin is the latest example.

author: David K. Li
description: A former Michigan State grad student blamed her thyroid cancer on the school, which allegedly told her that "exposure was harmless" when she worked with various pesticides and herbicides, she and her lawyers said on Monday
title: Former Michigan State student says she got cancer after using chemicals school called 'harmless'

description: Democratic members of the Texas House are vowing to take their fight over Republican redistricting efforts to court. Members of the caucus previously fled the state to disrupt voting on redistricting.
title: Texas Democrats end two-week standoff over redistricting effort

description: Russia has continued to bomb Ukrainian civilians as peace talks to end the war are ongoing. NBC News’ Richard Engel details Ukrainian reaction to the meetings and what could happen to the people who may have to surrender to Russia.
title: Ukrainians watch peace talks as Russian bombing continues

author: Matt Bradley
description: Hundreds of thousands of people shouted slogans and booed mentions of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at nationwide protests across Israel about the Gaza war.
title: Hundreds of thousands protest Gaza war as frustration grows in Israel about new offensive

description: NBC News' Peter Alexander and Keir Simmons report on how President Donald Trump's second meeting in the Oval Office with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy contrasted with their first meeting six months prior.
title: How Trump and Zelenskyy's second Oval Office meeting differed from the first

author: Doha Madani
description: A University of Nebraska Omaha basketball player was identified as a drowning victim at a reservoir in the Salt Lake City area over the weekend after divers recovered his body.
title: Nebraska college basketball player drowns in Utah reservoir

author: Karma Dickerson, NBC Los Angeles
description: After a man was struck and killed by a SUV Thursday while running from a federal immigration enforcement operation at a Home Depot in Monrovia, California, immigrant communities are once again condemning the federal government’s tactics while mourning the crash victim.
title: What we know about man killed while running from ICE agents in Monrovia

author: Joe Murphy
description: The first hurricane of the 2025 Atlantic season is also one of the largest, fastest-growing hurricanes in recorded history
title: Storm tracker: Follow Hurricane Erin’s path, wind speeds and forecast

description: Two police officers were fatally shot and a third was wounded when a man opened fire as they responded to a domestic violence call at a home in Tremonton, Utah.
title: Police describe timeline of fatal Utah shooting

author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
description: When Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
title: Despite RFK Jr.'s claims, vaccine panels have had record-low conflicts for years, study finds

author: Erik Ortiz
description: A surviving roommate who encountered the masked intruder who slaughtered four University of Idaho students in an off-campus home in 2022 initially told investigators she heard an unknown male voice refer to a victim by her name
title: Bryan Kohberger said name of victim during attack on Idaho students, documents show

author: Ben Kamisar
description: Texas Democratic lawmakers said they had returned to the state Monday after a two-week absence that temporarily blocked Republican leaders from enacting a plan aimed at padding their party's majority in the U.S.
title: Texas Democrats return to the state, ending two-week standoff over redistricting

author: Daniel Arkin
description: MSNBC will change its name to My Source News Opinion World (MS NOW) and unveil a new logo later this year as part of the cable news channel’s spinoff from the Comcast-owned media company NBCUniversal
title: MSNBC to change name to MS NOW amid spinoff from NBCUniversal

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Air Canada is suspending its guidance for third-quarter and full-year operating results after the union defied back-to-work orders, which further halted the airline's plan to resume flights.
title: Air Canada suspends third-quarter and full-year guidance following 'unlawful' strike

description: Thousands of people took to the streets of Tel Aviv to demand that all remaining Israeli hostages in Gaza are released. Ruby Chen, whose son Itay is being held hostage by Hamas in Gaza, told NBC News that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has a “legal, moral and Jewish responsibility” to ensure the release of all hostages.
title: Israeli protesters demand release of hostages in Gaza

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Hurricane Erin remains a Category 4 storm, forecast to bring life-threatening surf and rip currents across the U.S.
title: Hurricane Erin forecasted to bring life-threatening surf and rip currents as Category 4

description: Terence Stamp, the English actor best known for playing General Zod in two of the “Superman” movies and for his role in “The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert,” has died at 87. Stamp received an Oscar nomination and a Golden Globe award for “Billy Budd.” Reporting for TODAY, NBC’s Joe Fryer looks back at Stamp’s wide-ranging career.
title: Terence Stamp, General Zod in ‘Superman,’ Dies at 87

author: Freddie Clayton
description: European leaders will support Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday as President Trump fueled new alarm among Ukraine's allies after his summit with Vladimir Putin.
title: Ukraine brings reinforcements to Trump meeting, hoping to avoid another White House fiasco

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump holds meetings with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy and other European leaders at the White House. This comes just days after Trump's meeting with Russian President Putin in Alaska on a potential ceasefire deal for the war in Ukraine.
title: Trump meets with Zelenskyy and European leaders

description: Newly released documents from Idaho State Police reveal a surviving roommate told officers she heard Bryan Kohberger call one of the victims by name during the attack that left four college students, Madison Mogen, Kaylee Goncalves, Xana Kernodle and Ethan Chapin dead. The roommate told officers she heard a male voice say, "It's ok Kaylee, I'm here for you." NBC’s Morgan Chesky reports for TODAY.
title: Idaho Survivor Told Police Bryan Kohberger Said Victim's Name

description: The status of Air Canada’s flight schedule is still up in the air after the flight attendants union tore up a government order to return to work. The airline, which operates roughly 700 flights a day, halted all operations on Saturday leaving an estimated 100,000 travelers with nowhere to go. NBC’s Sam Brock reports for TODAY.
title: Air Canada Workers Defy Government Order to Return to Work

description: After pummeling the Caribbean as a Category 3 hurricane over the weekend, Hurricane Erin has restrengthened to a Category 4 and is expected to bring life-threatening waves and rip currents up and down the East Coast. NBC’s Jesse Kirsch reports and TODAY’s Dylan Dreyer tracks the latest forecast.
title: Hurricane Erin Restrengthens to Category 4: Where it's Headed

author: Kayla Hayempour
description: Zelenskyy and Trump will meet, joined by European leaders. Trump administration investigates Democrats. Police search for gunmen in a Brooklyn club shooting.
title: Zelenskyy's D.C. meeting and Terence Stamp dies at 87: Morning Rundown

description: President Donald Trump is set to host Volodymyr Zelenskyy at the White House where the Ukrainian president will be joined by the leaders of France, Germany and the United Kingdom to present a united front in their efforts to end Russia’s war with Ukraine. It comes just days after Trump’s face-to-face with Putin in Alaska in which no agreements were reached. NBC’s Garrett Haake reports and Meet the Press moderator Kristen Welker provides analysis for TODAY.
title: Top European Leaders Join Zelenskyy for WH Meeting With Trump

author: Henry J. Gomez
description: Former Sen. Sherrod Brown, D-Ohio, launched a comeback campaign Monday, setting the stage for a 2026 special election that could decide control of the Senate.
title: Former Sen. Sherrod Brown kicks off his bid for Vance's old Senate seat in Ohio

author: David Rohde
description: For three years, Mike Davis, a Republican lawyer, has pushed for federal criminal investigations of Hillary Clinton, Barack Obama, Joe Biden and senior FBI, CIA and Justice Department officials.
title: Obama, Biden and Clinton criminal investigations are most likely approaching, Trump ally says

description: At least seven people were killed in an overnight Russian drone strike on the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv as President Zelenskyy travels to Washington to meet with President Trump and other European leaders. Video shows first responders rescuing a woman from the rubble of a residential building that was hit in the strike.
title: Russia pummels eastern Ukraine as Zelenskyy travels to Washington
